meanings.definition: A mark or indentation made by pressure
meanings.sent1: The dog's paw left imprints in the wet mud.
meanings.sent2: I could see the imprints of the keys on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The imprints of the chair on my skin made me look like a zebra!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness left an imprint on my heart that I will never forget.
meanings.sent5: The imprints of history can still be seen on the ancient walls.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's words left lasting imprints on the students' minds.
meanings.sent2: The imprints of his leadership were evident in the company's success.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes left a lasting imprint of laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her smile made an imprint on his heart that never faded.
meanings.sent5: The imprints of her kindness were felt by everyone she met.

meanings.definition: To mark or stamp with a design or pattern
meanings.sent1: She imprints her initials on all her belongings.
meanings.sent2: The artist imprints the canvas with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: He tried to imprint his face on the soft dough for fun.
meanings.sent4: The logo was imprinted on the packaging for brand recognition.
meanings.sent5: The potter imprints unique patterns on each piece of pottery.

meanings.definition: To fix firmly in the mind or memory
meanings.sent1: The song lyrics imprinted themselves in my mind after just one listen.
meanings.sent2: The traumatic experience imprinted itself in her memory forever.
meanings.sent3: He tried to imprint the grocery list in his mind but kept forgetting.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery imprinted itself in his memory like a painting.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of her grandmother were imprinted in her heart forever.
